titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abbott Lowell Cummings Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Christine Connolly

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:58

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist primarily of student research papers, photocopies of public records, and reports on historic homes of Connecticut. Files on seventeenth century domestic architecture and on one home in Massachusettes are also included. Many of the papers and reports were completed by students in Cummings's architecture history classes at Yale University, but several reports were written by Cummings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the History of Art Department, 1996.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged in two sections: Seventeenth Century Domestic Architecture and Research and project files on historic homes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
Original student papers in box 3 are restricted until January 1, 2067. Patrons must use the redacted versions of the papers in box 6.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abbott Lowell Cummings Papers (MS 1713). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Abbott Lowell Cummings, noted authority on American architecture, received his B.A. from Oberlin College in 1945, and his Ph.D. from Ohio State University in 1950. In 1955 he became assistant director of the Society for the Preservation of New England Antiquities. He remained with the Society until December, 1983, eventually becoming executive director. In 1984 he became the Charles F. Montgomery Professor of American Decorative Arts at Yale University. He retired and achieved emeritus status in 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist primarily of student research papers, photocopies of public records, and reports on historic homes of Connecticut. Files on seventeenth century domestic architecture and on one home in Massachusettes are also included. Many of the papers and reports were completed by students in Cummings's architecture history classes at Yale University, but several reports were written by Cummings.

did.unittitle: Seventeenth Century Domestic Architecture course, History of Art (student notebooks)
Research and project files on historic homes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material restricted until January 1, 2067 as established by Yale Corporation regulations. See redacted use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records consist mainly of photocopies of probate documents.
